title: Trump: Intel Agreed to Give US a 10% Stake (Full Q&A)
description:
President Donald Trump said Intel Corp. had agreed to give the US government a 10% equity stake in the beleaguered chipmaker, with a formal announcement expected on Friday, according to people familiar with the matter.
“They’ve agreed to do it and I think it’s a great deal for them,” Trump told reporters Friday at the White House.
Trump cast the agreement as one that would revitalize the company, saying that “Intel has been left behind” compared to competitors in the chipmaking industry, and that he had floated the idea when he met with Intel Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan earlier this month. (Source: Bloomberg)

summary: President Donald Trump has responded to questions about the search of a bicycle by his deputy, Ernie Bass, and his personal life. He stated that due to tariffs and incentives, it is impossible for another country to stop the resurgence of this activity. He also mentioned that he is working on a resolution to be good to Canada and that he does not mind John Bolton's controversial tactics. He dismissed Bolton's claims that his actions were influenced by Trump derangement syndrome, and expressed a desire to have a meeting with him and his wife, Pam, regarding the situation. The president also commented on the ongoing battle with FIFA and the potential for a nuclear war with India and Pakistan. He highlighted the economic impact on American cities that are poorly run and criticized the mayor's lack of permits and the governor's incompetence.
